subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: Checks that certain exception types do not appear in a catch statement.

Rationale: catching java.lang.Exception, java.lang.Error or java.lang.RuntimeException is almost never acceptable. Novice developers often simply catch Exception in an attempt to handle multiple exception classes. This unfortunately leads to code that inadvertently catches NullPointerException, OutOfMemoryError, etc.

tr.td: Specify exception class names to reject.

td.code: Error, Exception, RuntimeException, Throwable, java.lang.Error, java.lang.Exception, java.lang.RuntimeException, java.lang.Throwable

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: To configure the check to override the default list with ArithmeticException and OutOfMemoryError:
subsection.source: <module name="Checker"> <module name="TreeWalker"> <module name="IllegalCatch"> <property name="illegalClassNames" value="ArithmeticException, OutOfMemoryError"/> </module> </module> </module>

subsection.name: Violation Messages
subsection.p: All messages can be customized if the default message doesn't suit you. Please see the documentation to learn how to.
